intro: Panzerina lanata var. albescens, commonly known as the white-haired panzerina, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive, rugged appearance.
